body:
Comment 5 by **lucio.dere**: 
I have also determined that the error can be triggered both on NetBSD and Ubuntu (Linux)
by prefixing ./make.bash with "GO386=387".  So I guess the error lies in cmd/8g/ggen.c
around line 1117, where the "387" code is generated.  But I can't figure the exact
details, so someone else had better look into it.

Seems like there are very few Go developers with old kit floating around!

Lucio.
